examples: I fell in the stream and got drenched
a severe drenching would kill his uncle

verb.description: Forcibly administer a drug in liquid form orally to (an animal).

noun.description: A dose of medicine administered to an animal.

origin: Old English drencan force to drink, drenc a drink or draft, of Germanic origin; related to German tränken (verb), Trank (noun), also to drink.
